723986f-b.title: Manhattan: Washington Square West - Washington Place
723986f-b.text:
(1)
32 Washington Square West, at N.W. corner of Washington Place, the old Hicks-Lord house, built prior to 1850. Around 1928 it will be replaced by a fifteen story apartment building.
Compare the later view of it, around 1920.
September 8, 1905.
Brown Brothers.  Neg. #579
(2)
The same corner twenty-five years later, occupied by the new apartment building. The S.W. corner, across Washington Place, has just been cleared for building the 16-story Holley Chambers apartment hotel.
February 28, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
723986f-b.folder: Washington Square West & Washington Place, Manhattan, NY

724048f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Square West - Washington Place
724048f-a.text:
Washington Square West, from Washington Place to Waverly Place, inclusive, showing the clearing on the S.W. corner of Washington Place, the apartment building erected in 1927 on the N.W. corner, where the old Hicks-Lord house used to stand, and the new 30 Washington Square apartment building which replaces the old Washington and Peabody apartment houses, 100-04 Waverly Place.
February 28, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
724048f-a.folder: Washington Square West & Washington Place, Manhattan, NY

723977f-b.title: Manhattan: Washington Place - Washington Square West
723977f-b.text:
(1)
Washington Place, north side, west from, but not including Washington Square West, to and including Sixth Ave. Shown on the N.W. corner of Sixth Ave., is St. Joseph's R.C. Church.
May 28, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Sixth Avenue West side of block, south of Washington Place. After
the 'L' was removed.
June 17th,1939.
P.L.Sperr,
No Reproductions.
